page.title: 19 The old Railway.
page.content: There is a proposal which is causing a great deal of controversy at present.It is being suggested by the County Council that a section of the railway cutting south of the station site could be used to tip rubbish.When full,it would be covered with topsoil so that it could be restored to agriculture.The objections to this proposal are(1) that the village roads cannot cope with the volume of traffic,especially the heavy lorries which would be involved; (2) it would be an eyesore and would cause unpleasant smells and (3) the cutting has become a wonderful site for wild flowers (including rare orchids) as well as butterflies and other insects. Meanwhile,the railway bank to the north of the station site is to be planted with trees so that commercial forestry can take place.There have been no objections to this.
